title: Wednesday evening news briefing: Inside the Conservative election machine as 56 MPs say they will not stand on December 12
text:
Grenfell Tower: Fire chief refuses to resign after damning report

The London Fire Brigade's Commissioner Dany Cotton has refused to resignafter the official inquiry into the disaster concluded Boris Johnson must take "urgent action" over her firefighters' flawed response to the Grenfell Tower tragedy. Fewer people would have died had the fire service been better prepared to deal with the 2017 blaze, Sir Martin Moore-Bick has found in a damning 1,000 page report published today. The results of the inquiry have already led to calls from victims and their families for Miss Cotton to step down immediately and surrender her £2m pension. Watch her explain why she will not do so.

Passenger announcement: Gatwick trial to cut boarding times

Given how much airlines love to trumpet their punctuality (barely a month goes by without Ryanair claiming it is Europe's most on-time carrier) you'd expect them to try just about anything to speed up the boarding process. Even more so now that long delays can result in costly compensation claims. Now Gatwick has announced a two-month trial – at Gate 101 – during which it will test a variety of boarding techniques to find the most efficient. Oliver Smith explains how the innovations could cut times by 10 per cent - or even more.

News digest

Video: Bye bye to the man who tried to stop Brexit

The Speaker, John Bercow, closed Prime Minister's Questions with an emotional goodbye to the House. He thanked his staff for coming to watch his last one and his voice shook as he thanked his wife and children. Yet former Black Rod David Leakey has said it would be a scandal for him to be awarded a peerage. Read why and watch how he is the man who tried to stop Brexit.
description: If you want to receive twice-daily briefings like this by email, sign up to the Front Page newsletter here and try our Audio Briefings on WhatsApp.
